title: Free Estate Planning Webinar
location: https://mackaydressler.com/workshops/
description:
Details


Strategies to Manage Incapacity, Family Dynamics, and Financial Risks

Creating your estate plan, whether it‚Äôs a living trust or a will, can be a daunting task. Estate planning addresses issues that are difficult to think about, such as death, incapacity, finances, and family dynamics. It can be easy to procrastinate, even though these issues may weigh heavily on your mind.

We invite you to attend one of our upcoming free webinars so you can take the first step toward having peace of mind by creating (or updating) your estate plan. This is an educational webinar, where we highlight some of the concerns that many families face and how an estate plan can help. The attorneys also break down how wills and trusts differ, and some of the common estate planning pitfalls and how to avoid them.

Our goal is to provide you with the education you need to protect yourself and your family, and leave a legacy of peace. If you would like to set up a meeting to discuss your estate planning needs further, we offer all participants who complete the webinar a free, no obligation personal consultation with one of the attorneys.

At this webinar, we will discuss several common issues and concerns, including:

  * The advantages and disadvantages of wills, living trusts, and probate
  * Protecting your children‚Äôs inheritance from their future ex-spouses, lawsuits, and other claims
  * Most living trusts fail; if you already have a trust, find out what you can do to ensure that it will protect you and your loved ones
  * How to preserve your nest egg for your family if you find yourself needing Long Term Care
  * How to stay out of court and avoid the cost, time, and stress that a conservatorship can bring if you become incapacitated.

Attend a webinar and receive a FREE no-obligation consultation with an Attorney to answer any questions about setting up your estate plan ($550 value).

Source: Petaluma Downtown Association

title: Happy Hour Crafts
description:
The Rebel Craft Collective
Wine + tasty snacks + your latest project and a friendly group of likeminded crafters... what better way to unwind? Come join us!

This is a relaxed, drop-in-friendly event. Come when you can, leave when you must. Newcomers and occasional-comers are always welcome!

**What do we mean by ‚Äúcrafts‚Äù?**
Whatever ‚Äúcraft‚Äù means to you! And whatever is portable enough to bring to a wine bar. Knitting, crochet, and other fiber arts are most common, but we have also warmly welcomed people who sketch, color, embroider, bead, and more. If your craft isn‚Äôt portable, we will happily ooh and aah over photos of your work-in-progress, or chat about your plans for your next project.

**Health & Safety**
Masks are very welcome, and nobody will pressure you to eat or drink. If the weather is nice, we will try to sit outside. If you aren‚Äôt eating/drinking during the event, please consider ordering some of La Dolce Vita‚Äôs delicious food to-go, in order to help support our gracious, long-time venue.

**Parking**
Parking in downtown Petaluma is free, but street parking has a strictly enforced 2 hour limit until 6pm. To park for longer, try the nearest garage:

* The Second Street Garage entrance is located on C Street between First and Second Streets. It's all day parking on every level and a short walk to La Dolce Vita.

**Ages**
It's a wine bar, so this event is for adult crafters (though you're certainly not required to drink wine!). We‚Äôre okay with babes-in-arms if you are, but this is not the right setting for wee crafters who are moving about on their own.

Source: Meetup: Rebel Craft Collective

About Callie Watts

Callie Watts is a pop singer/songwriter from Northern California who was raised on classical music, The Beatles and The Beach Boys before discovering Joni Mitchell, Elton John, Stevie Wonder, Paul Simon, Billy Joel, Carole King, and all the great writers of the ‚Äô60s and 70‚Äôs who have influenced her sound and melodic writing style. After graduating high school, Callie began playing and performing solo, as well as in local and bay area bands of different genres. She has taken turns throughout her career as a keyboardist, guitarist, writer, arranger, and lead/backing vocalist.

title: Russian River Fungi Fest in Guerneville
description:
Sonoma-Marin Brat Pack
Let's meet in downtown Guerneville on Saturday, Feb. 21st at 12pm to learn more about mushrooms (tasty gourmet ones, not the "magic" kind) while socializing at the same time.

You don't actually need a ticket to attend, but they do offer them on Eventbrite for a $15 suggested donation to help defray costs of getting it up and running. Hopefully weather will be on our side for this one! I think most of the events will be outside. They will have live music, a mushroom market, workshops and more. Restaurants will offer special mushroom-themed menus. Solar Punk Farms and the Russian River Chamber of Commerce are organizing the event.

More details here:
https://www.solarpunkfarms.com/fungifest

Any questions, just message DJ through Meetup. The event actually runs from 10am-6pm on both Feb. 21st and 22nd, but we'll just be there for about 3 hours on Saturday the 21st, unless anyone wants to stay longer. We'll pick a good meeting place as soon as they release more details.

title: Free Estate Planning Webinar
location: https://mackaydressler.com/workshops/
description:
Creating your estate plan, whether it‚Äôs a living trust or a will, can be a daunting task. Estate planning addresses issues that are difficult to think about, such as death, incapacity, finances, and family dynamics. It can be easy to procrastinate, even though these issues may weigh heavily on your mind.

We invite you to attend one of our upcoming free webinars so you can take the first step toward having peace of mind by creating (or updating) your estate plan. This is an educational webinar, where we highlight some of the concerns that many families face and how an estate plan can help. The attorneys also break down how wills and trusts differ, and some of the common estate planning pitfalls and how to avoid them.

Our goal is to provide you with the education you need to protect yourself and your family, and leave a legacy of peace. If you would like to set up a meeting to discuss your estate planning needs further, we offer all participants who complete the webinar a free, no obligation personal consultation with one of the attorneys.

At this webinar, we will discuss several common issues and concerns, including:

  * The advantages and disadvantages of wills, living trusts, and probate
  * Protecting your children‚Äôs inheritance from their future ex-spouses, lawsuits, and other claims
  * Most living trusts fail; if you already have a trust, find out what you can do to ensure that it will protect you and your loved ones
  * How to preserve your nest egg for your family if you find yourself needing Long Term Care
  * How to stay out of court and avoid the cost, time, and stress that a conservatorship can bring if you become incapacitated.

Attend a webinar and receive a FREE no-obligation consultation with an Attorney to answer any questions about setting up your estate plan ($425 value).

Source: Petaluma Downtown Association

description:

Join us for an evening of creativity and inspiration at the Petaluma Figure Drawing Meetup Group's Figure Drawing Night at Suite G Studio! Whether you're a seasoned artist or just starting out, this event is the perfect opportunity to hone your skills, meet fellow artists, and immerse yourself in the world of figurative painting. Our life drawing sessions are open to artists and art lovers of all levels, so don't be shy to join us and express your creativity on paper. We provide a supportive and encouraging environment where everyone can feel comfortable exploring their artistic talents.

Whether you prefer using pencils, charcoal, pastels, or paint, there's something for everyone at our Figure Drawing Night. Come and be a part of our community of artists dedicated to celebrating and expressing the beauty of life through art.

title: Happy Hour Crafts
description:
The Rebel Craft Collective
Wine + tasty snacks + your latest project and a friendly group of likeminded crafters... what better way to unwind? Come join us!

This is a relaxed, drop-in-friendly event. Come when you can, leave when you must. Newcomers and occasional-comers are always welcome!

**What do we mean by ‚Äúcrafts‚Äù?**
Whatever ‚Äúcraft‚Äù means to you! And whatever is portable enough to bring to a wine bar. Knitting, crochet, and other fiber arts are most common, but we have also warmly welcomed people who sketch, color, embroider, bead, and more. If your craft isn‚Äôt portable, we will happily ooh and aah over photos of your work-in-progress, or chat about your plans for your next project.

**Health & Safety**
Masks are very welcome, and nobody will pressure you to eat or drink. If the weather is nice, we will try to sit outside. If you aren‚Äôt eating/drinking during the event, please consider ordering some of La Dolce Vita‚Äôs delicious food to-go, in order to help support our gracious, long-time venue.

**Parking**
Parking in downtown Petaluma is free, but street parking has a strictly enforced 2 hour limit until 6pm. To park for longer, try the nearest garage:

* The Second Street Garage entrance is located on C Street between First and Second Streets. It's all day parking on every level and a short walk to La Dolce Vita.

**Ages**
It's a wine bar, so this event is for adult crafters (though you're certainly not required to drink wine!). We‚Äôre okay with babes-in-arms if you are, but this is not the right setting for wee crafters who are moving about on their own.

Source: Meetup: Rebel Craft Collective

Reserve your spot on Tock https://www.exploretock.com/adoberoadwines/ and make it a memorable night of great music, fine wine, and good company!

About Peter Filice

A lifelong vocalist and guitar player, Peter has been in the Bay Area music scene since the 1990‚Äôs. He was vocalist and guitarist for the South Bay band OTR, winners of the KFOX Last Band Standing competition in 2010, and subsequently, in 2015, started a very successful acoustic act, P.S. Acoustic Music, performing in solo, duo, and trio formats at numerous South Bay venues. He also has performed in tribute shows to Creedence Clearwater Revival, Three Dog Night, Linda Ronstadt, and his own Simon and Garfunkel tribute. title: Opening Reception: Collaborative Works 2026 by Connect the Dots Art Studio
location: Usher Gallery,1 Petaluma Blvd N
description:
"Collaborative Works 2026" showcases a selection of paintings and textiles by Anna Rochester and Barbara Libby-Steinmann. Inspired by the natural landscapes of Marin and Sonoma Counties, the artists engage in direct collaboration, applying their respective skills simultaneously to each piece. This approach yields both large-scale and smaller works, which are on view at Usher Gallery from February 17th to March 22nd.

Join us for the opening reception on Saturday, February 28th, from 5-8pm to celebrate ‚ÄúCollaborative Works 2026‚Äù, enjoy live music by Rojo, meet the artists, and graze on light refreshments and wine.

Anna and Barbara serve as co-directors of Connect the Dots Art Studio (CTD), a recently established arts-based nonprofit in Marin. CTD brings people together to experience art through installations, workshops, and events that invite individuals to tap into and express their creativity. By ‚Äúconnecting the dots,‚Äù CTD creates opportunities for the community to engage with art, make art, buy art, and connect with artists and creative individuals. More details about CTD can be found at: connectthedotsartstudio.org/ https://connectthedotsartstudio.org/ https://connectthedotsartstudio.org email: art@connectthedotsartstudio.org mailto:art@connectthedotsartstudio.org

title: Free Estate Planning Seminar
location: Sheraton Hotel Petaluma,745 Baywood Drive, Petaluma, CA 94954, USA
description:
AT THIS COMPLIMENTARY PRESENTATION, WE WILL DISCUSS SEVERAL TOPICS INCLUDING:

  * One Big Beautiful Bill Act: How the new tax law may impact trusts, estate planning, and family succession strategies.
  * Wills and Living Trusts: Learn the advantages and disadvantages to both.
  * Asset Protection: How to protect your assets and your family‚Äôs inheritance from creditors, divorce, and lawsuits.
  * Long Term Care Planning: How to avoid losing your life savings.
  * Next Spouse Protection: How to protect your assets from your surviving spouse‚Äôs next spouse.
  * Probate: What is it and how to prevent it.
  * Estate Taxes: What are they, and how to minimize or eliminate.
  * Gifting to Children: How and when to gift your assets and why putting property in children‚Äôs names may be a mistake.
  * Special Needs: How to provide for special needs (disabled) children and grandchildren.
  * Legacy Planning: Good planning involves more than money. Learn some powerful tools to help instill important values in younger generation family members.
  * And much, much more‚Ä¶

Source: Petaluma Downtown Association

title: The Hidden Girl and Other Stories
description:
Petaluma Book (And Brew) Club
From stories about time-travelling assassins to *Black Mirror*-esque tales of cryptocurreny and internet trolling, to heartbreaking narratives of parent-child relationships, *The Hidden Girl and Other Stories* is a far-reaching work that explores topical themes from the present and a visionary look at humanity's future.

This collection includes a selection of Liu's speculative fiction stories over the past five years ‚Äî seventeen of his best ‚Äî plus a new novelette. In addition, it also features an excerpt from the *The Veiled Throne*, the third book in Liu's epic fantasy series *The Dandelion Dynasty*.

title: Happy Hour Crafts
description:
The Rebel Craft Collective
Wine + tasty snacks + your latest project and a friendly group of likeminded crafters... what better way to unwind? Come join us!

This is a relaxed, drop-in-friendly event. Come when you can, leave when you must. Newcomers and occasional-comers are always welcome!

**What do we mean by ‚Äúcrafts‚Äù?**
Whatever ‚Äúcraft‚Äù means to you! And whatever is portable enough to bring to a wine bar. Knitting, crochet, and other fiber arts are most common, but we have also warmly welcomed people who sketch, color, embroider, bead, and more. If your craft isn‚Äôt portable, we will happily ooh and aah over photos of your work-in-progress, or chat about your plans for your next project.

**Health & Safety**
Masks are very welcome, and nobody will pressure you to eat or drink. If the weather is nice, we will try to sit outside. If you aren‚Äôt eating/drinking during the event, please consider ordering some of La Dolce Vita‚Äôs delicious food to-go, in order to help support our gracious, long-time venue.

**Parking**
Parking in downtown Petaluma is free, but street parking has a strictly enforced 2 hour limit until 6pm. To park for longer, try the nearest garage:

* The Second Street Garage entrance is located on C Street between First and Second Streets. It's all day parking on every level and a short walk to La Dolce Vita.

**Ages**
It's a wine bar, so this event is for adult crafters (though you're certainly not required to drink wine!). We‚Äôre okay with babes-in-arms if you are, but this is not the right setting for wee crafters who are moving about on their own.

Source: Meetup: Rebel Craft Collective

title: Happy Hour Crafts
description:
The Rebel Craft Collective
Wine + tasty snacks + your latest project and a friendly group of likeminded crafters... what better way to unwind? Come join us!

This is a relaxed, drop-in-friendly event. Come when you can, leave when you must. Newcomers and occasional-comers are always welcome!

**What do we mean by ‚Äúcrafts‚Äù?**
Whatever ‚Äúcraft‚Äù means to you! And whatever is portable enough to bring to a wine bar. Knitting, crochet, and other fiber arts are most common, but we have also warmly welcomed people who sketch, color, embroider, bead, and more. If your craft isn‚Äôt portable, we will happily ooh and aah over photos of your work-in-progress, or chat about your plans for your next project.

**Health & Safety**
Masks are very welcome, and nobody will pressure you to eat or drink. If the weather is nice, we will try to sit outside. If you aren‚Äôt eating/drinking during the event, please consider ordering some of La Dolce Vita‚Äôs delicious food to-go, in order to help support our gracious, long-time venue.

**Parking**
Parking in downtown Petaluma is free, but street parking has a strictly enforced 2 hour limit until 6pm. To park for longer, try the nearest garage:

* The Second Street Garage entrance is located on C Street between First and Second Streets. It's all day parking on every level and a short walk to La Dolce Vita.

**Ages**
It's a wine bar, so this event is for adult crafters (though you're certainly not required to drink wine!). We‚Äôre okay with babes-in-arms if you are, but this is not the right setting for wee crafters who are moving about on their own.

title: Butter & Egg Days Parade and Festival
location: Downtown Petaluma,20 4th St, Petaluma, CA 94952, USA
description:
2026 Annual Butter & Egg Days Parade and Festival

Date: Saturday, April 18, 2026

Step into Petaluma's flowering world of curiosity and delight!

The 2026 Butter & Egg Days Parade will take place Saturday, April 18. Participants and spectators alike to celebrate the magic and charm of our historic town. Colorful floats, costumed participants, and lively performances will celebrate Petaluma‚Äôs rich history and agricultural heritage. Join in a day of fun and local pride that promises to delight visitors of all ages!

The Butter & Egg Days festivities kick off on Saturday, April 11 with the Opening Ceremonies at the Petaluma Historical Library and Museum (20 Fourth St), from Noon to 1pm. Mayor Kevin McDonnell will read a proclamation honoring the Grand Marshal and Good Egg. Come enjoy this display that shows the heart of our community.

One week later on Saturday, April 18, the Butter & Egg Days Parade steps off at noon and will march through the historic downtown. The parade will showcase over 100 units with approximately 3,000 participants and 200 volunteers. Clover Sonoma will return to lead the Clover Kids‚Äô Parade, which precedes the main parade at 11:30am with a procession of preschoolers and primary grade youngsters and their families.

The parade is surrounded by a Festival that spreads over four city blocks from 10am-5pm offering a wide variety of food, crafts, beverage gardens, two large kid areas, live music, and more! This annual event aims to bring together the community for a day of fun and entertainment.

The following weekend, Downtown Petaluma continues the celebration with our Annual Antique Faire, on Sunday, April 26.

Visit ButterAndEggDays.com http://www.ButterAndEggDays.com for more information.

Happy Butter & Egg Days!!

Source: Petaluma Downtown Association

title: Petaluma Spring Antique Faire
location: Downtown Petaluma,20 4th St, Petaluma, CA 94952, USA
description:
Petaluma Spring Antique Faire

The much-anticipated Petaluma Spring Antique Faire returns on April 26, from 8am to 4pm, in Historic Downtown Petaluma. The Faire is located on Western Ave, the A Street Parking lot, and 4th & Kentucky Streets between B Street and Washington Street.

"The Bay Area's Premier Antique Center," Historic Downtown Petaluma will transform into an antique marketplace. Amid the beautiful historic buildings, one-of-a-kind stores, an incredible array of restaurants and cafes, guests can find an incomparable selection of affordable antiques from over 200 dealers. description:
Overview

Celebrate Mother‚Äôs Day with a rejuvenating self-care experience‚Äîpamper, relax, and glow alongside the women you love.

Join us at Allume Med Spa for our Allume Facial Event, a Mother‚Äôs Day‚Äìinspired self-care experience designed to honor and celebrate moms, caregivers, and the special women in your life.

This event is the perfect opportunity to treat yourself‚Äîor bring your mother, daughter, sister, or friend‚Äîfor a shared day of relaxation, rejuvenation, and radiant skin. Spend quality time together while enjoying a series of indulgent treatments in a calm, spa-like environment.


Event Pricing:

  * $199 for two people
  * $119 for one person (single bookings must call to schedule)

Important scheduling note:
This is a timed experience. The event runs from 9:00 AM ‚Äì 3:00 PM, and each guest will select an individual treatment time within that window.
After purchasing your ticket, please call Allume Med Spa to reserve your preferred time slot.
Single-person bookings are scheduled by phone only.


Your Allume facial experience includes:

  * 30-Minute Glow Facial customized to refresh and illuminate your skin
  * LED Light Therapy to promote healing and enhance radiance
  * Chair Massage for deep relaxation
  * Lymphatic Drainage to reduce puffiness and support detoxification
  * Cervical Neck Care to release tension and improve circulation
  * Sound Bath Immersion for full-body relaxation
  * Essential Oil Aromatherapy to enhance your sensory experience
  * Paraffin Hand Treatment to deeply hydrate and soften skin
  * Spa Refreshments to enjoy while you unwind

Make this Mother‚Äôs Day special by gifting yourself‚Äîor a loved one‚Äîa restorative and luxurious self-care experience at Allume. Celebrate the women in your life with glowing skin, calm energy, and shared moments of wellness.

‚ú® Limited availability. Advance registration and phone scheduling required.

title: Petaluma Art & Garden Festival
location: Historic Downtown Petaluma,20 4th St, Petaluma, CA 94952, USA
description:
Petaluma Art & Garden Festival

The Art & Garden festival is one of Petaluma's most loved events! Join us Sunday, July 12, 2026 from 11 am to 5 pm for a fun filled day for all the family. Local crafters, artisans, gardeners, live music on two stages, and an array of local wineries, breweries, restaurants, and fine food purveyors will be participating.

The Art & Garden Festival will take place on Kentucky Street, Fourth Street, B Street, and A Street parking lot. Event Headquarters are at 20 4th Street, Petaluma.

This event is free to attend with Tasting Packages available to those who wish to partake in all the great wine, craft beer, cider, cocktails, and more.

Not the typical street fair, vendors are handpicked and will be showcasing quality, creative home and garden d√©cor, jewelry, arts, and more. With over 100 booths of unusual, unique, handmade items, this event has something for everyone‚Äôs taste and budget.

Experts will be on hand to answer gardening questions. Figure out how to grow vegetables in tricky Petaluma adobe soil and what makes a garden organic.

While parents are eating and dancing, kids can enjoy the children‚Äôs corner, with jumpy, face painting, FREE hands-on arts and crafts, and more!

Visit http://PetalumaDowntown.com for more information!

Source: Petaluma Downtown Association

A time of Bats and Broomsticks, Blood and Bugs - and of course, Downtown Petaluma‚Äôs Safe ‚ÄúTrick or Treat Trail‚Äù with the downtown Merchants!

Parents - gather your little ghosts, goblins, monsters, Harry Potters, witches on broomsticks, and princesses, and join the participating downtown merchants for the Annual Trick or Treat Trail this Halloween, Saturday, October 31 ~ from 3pm-5:30pm!

title: Santa's Riverboat Arrival & Small Business Saturday
location: River Plaza Shopping Center,54 E Washington St, Petaluma, CA 94952, USA
description:
Santa's Riverboat Arrival

Saturday, November 28, 2026

11:30am - 1:30pm at River Plaza Shopping Center

Santa and Mrs. Claus are coming to town on November 28, the Saturday after Thanksgiving!

When Santa arrives in Petaluma, he leaves his sleigh at home. Instead, he and Mrs. Claus make a uniquely Petaluma arrival - they sail up the Petaluma River on a Lind Marine tugboat and dock at River Plaza Shopping Center on E. Washington to the cheers of excited children!

Starting at 11:30 am, families will enjoy live entertainment while waiting for Santa and Mrs. Claus to arrive! The Christmas couple will arrive around noon and will be welcomed by costumed dancers from the Petaluma School of Ballet‚Äôs ‚ÄúNutcracker.‚Äù Santa and Mrs. Claus will make their way across the parking lot to their festive tent outside Taps Restaurant where they will be available for family photos. Be sure to bring your Christmas wish list!

Santa would love to spend all afternoon in Petaluma, but in order to hear from all the good boys and girls all over the world, he will have to be on his way to his next destination at 1:30 pm.

Don‚Äôt let the fun stop there! Keep the festive mood flowing by taking your Shop Small swag bag and make the short walk to historic downtown Petaluma to support local shopping. When we all shop small, it's not just for the things we love, but for the businesses we love, for the community we call home, and to help promote local economic growth. Learn more about Small Business Saturday http://shopsmall.com/ and visit the official Small Business Saturday Facebook https://www.facebook.com/shopsmall/ page. And take advance of shop small benefits by using your American Express card by viewing this link here https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/maps?country=US&near=Petaluma,CA&cat=Shop-Small&cl=38.232417,-122.6366524&intlink=us-GABM-Shop_Small_Map .

Visit http://PetalumaDowntown.com for more information!

Source: Petaluma Downtown Association
